intro: Lobivia pugionacantha var. salitrensis, commonly known as the Salitrén Lobivia, is a succulent native to the arid regions of central South America. It features thick, ribbed stems and produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months. The plant is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions, storing water in its fleshy leaves and stems. Its natural habitat includes rocky soils and coastal areas, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
